verbose_text: XREF_BIBR In humans, low maternal vitamin D status has been shown to affect bone mineral content in the offspring via methylation of the retinoid-X receptor-alpha, an essential cofactor in facilitating the actions of vitamin D. XREF_BIBR Individuals from the Dutch famine birth cohort had, even after 60 years, less deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) methylation of the Insulin like growth factor 2 (IGF2) gene compared to their gender matched siblings who were not exposed to the famine in utero.
